name: Floodplain permeability
functionStatement: Surface water-groundwater exchange moderates temperature, transforms nutrients, supplies oxygen, and supports aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain soils allow hyporheic/groundwater exchange, consistent with local reference.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess soil texture and permeability in the floodplain using a hand texture test or auger. Use soils GIS as a desktop proxy where field access is limited.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Spoil berms or compacted fill along banks.
Criteria: Heavily compacted or lined. Minimal subsurface exchange.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Clayey overbank deposits or shallow bedrock exposed.
Criteria: Mostly fine or shallow bedrock that limits infiltration.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mixed sand over clay. Localized perched layers.
Criteria: Partially permeable. Some clogging layers.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Hand-textured sands and sandy loams in frequently inundated swales. Groundwater mounding observed after floods.
Criteria: Predominantly permeable floodplain soils supporting subsurface flow.

references: SSURGO or gSSURGO soils (HSG, Ksat, texture)
